Title: Chesterfield Borough Council Consultancy Advice
Description:
Chesterfield Borough Council is seeking to procure a suitably qualified consultant to undertake a feasibility study into the potential creation of the Derbyshire Rail Industry  Innovation Vehicle (DRIIVe) facility at Barrow Hill Round House in Chesterfield. The maximum budget for the feasibility study is circa ?50,000 inc VAT.
      
      It is envisaged that DRIIVe will see the creation of a Rail Innovation and Training Centre that will enhance an already thriving centre of railway maintenance and engineering.  In addition to a suite of specialist Rail Research and Development Laboratories and a Training Centre, the facility will provide commercial office and rail engineering workshop space.  
      The concept has been developed as a result of a collaborative partnership between Barrow Hill Engine Shed Society, Chesterfield Borough Council, Chesterfield College, the University of Derby and Newcastle University.   Partners have committed to working with a single inward investor to develop DRIIVe where the intention is that the facility will become a focus for rail innovation and training as well as providing commercial office and rail engineering  workshop space.  It is hoped that DRIIVe will facilitate growth in jobs across the wider supply chain, building upon the existing commercial offer at Barrow Hill which currently supports 65 rail related jobs.
      The purpose of the feasibility study is to inform and formalise discussions taking place  around the development of the DRIIVe Centre.  It is envisaged that the feasibility study will help us understand how the proposed uses within the building will function and based on this provide design and cost proposals for the centre up to RIBA stage 2+,  that take into account the site and its environment.
      
      How to Express Interest in this Tender: 
      
      1. Register your company on the eSourcing portal (this is only required once) - Browse to the eSourcing Portal: https://in-tendhost.co.uk/noecpc and click the link to register - Enter your correct business and user details - Note: your username will be the email address you have entered - you will also then shortly receive an email confirmation. 
      2. Once registered access the site and from the Home page hover over 'Tenders' on the tool bar  and select 'current tenders' from the drop down options
      3. Express Interest in the tender you are interested in - Select `Express Interest` within the Tender Details ( located at the bottom of the synopsis).  On doing so, you will instantly have access to the Tender Management area for that tender.  Any available documentation will be available via the various relevant tabs.  You can access this area at any point by logging in, navigating to `My Tenders` and selecting `View Details`.
      4. Responding to the tender - There will be a tab allocated to any tender stage (e.g. SQ and/or ITT).  Under the `My Tender Return` area, you will be required to complete any mandatory questionnaires and upload any requested do...

Title: The Hold Cost Consultant
Description:
Suffolk County Council wishes to appoint a Cost Consultant to provide estimates, advice, and other cost consultancy services regarding the cost of construction for The Hold; initially, this will be up to and including RIBA stage 3 design level, obtain planning, building regulations and any other consents. Subject to securing Round 2 HLF funding, the contract would then be extended to complete development, to include production of detailed designs and specifications, and assist with the production and evaluation of ITT documents for construction contractors, and to provide pre and post tender advice.

The Tender Documentation can be found at www.suffolksourcing.co.uk
Additional Text: The tender documentation can be found at www.suffolksourcing.co.uk

Title: CBC-0923-FC-CE Potton Road Housing Development - Design and Contract Admin Services - AWARD
Description:
You are invited to tender for multi-disciplinary design consultants and Principal Designer and contract administration services. This will be for a proposed 8 no. Shared ownership/Affordable rental Houses: - 2 X 3-bedroom houses and 6 X 2 bedroom houses scheme located on Potton Road, Wrestlingworth. 
      
      To be in accordance with the designer's duties and the terms and conditions of the ESPO Framework 2664 for Property, Building and Infrastructure Advice and Management Services.
      
      Return of Tender - Completed Tenders and attachments should be submitted electronically, by the due date via our "In-tend" electronic tendering system. Tenders must be uploaded via the "My Return" section of the system. Tenders submitted through the correspondence facility will not be considered. 
      
      Your Tender must be submitted via the In-Tend system by no later than 12:00 noon on 18th October 2018. Tenders received after that time will be excluded
      
      Help and Support - The Council will provide as much support and information as it can in order to help guide you through the Tender process.  Questions asked together with the Council's response will be made available to all tenderers to ensure a fair and consistent approach to all. If there is anything you are not sure of or need clarification on, please contact us using the Correspondence facility on the In-tend portal. Last date for receiving questions on Intend system 12 noon 12th October 2018. 
      
      Contract start date 31st October 2018.
